newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine firms reject tenders for U.S. wheat.
newsitem.headline: Philippine firms reject tenders for U.S. wheat.

text.p: Philippine firms on Friday rejected tenders for the supply of 35,000 tonnes U.S. wheat for February shipment, traders involved in the deal told Reuters.
"We rejected all offers because the average offer of $187 per tonne FOB was too high," an executive in one of the buying firms said.
Traders said the firms asked tenders for 29,000 tonnes dark northern spring wheat with a 14 percent protein content and 6,000 tonnes of western white wheat.
